details:
Several buffer overflow vulnerabilities were discovered in ethereal, a
network traffic analyzer. These vulnerabilities are described in the
ethereal advisory "enpa-sa-00013". Of these, only some parts of
[CAN-2004-0176](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0176) affect the version of ethereal in Debian woody.
[CAN-2004-0367](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0367) and [CAN-2004-0365](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2004-0365) are not applicable to this version.


For the current stable distribution (woody), these problems have been
fixed in version 0.9.4-1woody7.


For the unstable distribution (sid), these problems have been fixed in
version 0.10.3-1.


We recommend that you update your ethereal package.
